segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 46
segments.en: Linked Discourses 46

segments.pli: 3. Udāyivagga
segments.en: 3. With Udāyī

segments.pli: 30. Udāyisutta
segments.en: 30. With Udāyī

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sumbhesu viharati setakaṃ nāma sumbhānaṃ nigamo.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas called Sedaka.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Udāyī went up to the Buddha … and said to him:

segments.pli: “Acchariyaṃ, bhante, abbhutaṃ, bhante.
segments.en: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Yāva bahukatañca me, bhante, bhagavati pemañca gāravo ca hirī ca ottappañca.
segments.en: How helpful my love and respect for the Buddha have been, and my sense of conscience and prudence.

segments.pli: Ahañhi, bhante, pubbe agārikabhūto samāno abahukato ahosiṃ dhammena abahukato saṃghena.
segments.en: For when I was still a layman, I wasn’t helped much by the teaching or the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamāno agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.
segments.en: But when I considered my love and respect for the Buddha, and my sense of conscience and prudence, I went forth from the lay life to homelessness.

segments.pli: Tassa me bhagavā dhammaṃ desesi:
segments.en: The Buddha taught me the Dhamma:

segments.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
segments.en: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

segments.pli: iti vedanā … pe …
segments.en: Such is feeling …

segments.pli: iti saññā …
segments.en: Such is perception …

segments.pli: iti saṅkhārā …
segments.en: Such are choices …

segments.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti.
segments.en: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, suññāgāragato imesaṃ pañcupādānakkhandhānaṃ ukkujjāvakujjaṃ samparivattento ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ.
segments.en: Then, while staying in an empty hut, I followed the churning of the five grasping aggregates. I truly understood: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Dhammo ca me, bhante, abhisamito, maggo ca me paṭiladdho;
segments.en: I comprehended the teaching; I acquired the path.

segments.pli: yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
segments.en: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi.
segments.en: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

segments.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo me, bhante, paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
segments.en: I acquired the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi … pe …
upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo me, bhante, paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
segments.en: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, they will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi.
segments.en: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, bhante, maggo paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
segments.en: This is the path that I acquired. When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmī”ti.
segments.en: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, udāyi.
segments.en: “Good, good, Udāyī!

segments.pli: Eso hi te, udāyi, maggo paṭiladdho, yo te bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathā tvaṃ:
segments.en: For that is indeed the path that you acquired. When developed and cultivated as you’re living in such a way, it will bring you to such a state that you will understand:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissasī”ti.
segments.en: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Udāyivaggo tatiyo.
Bodhāya desanā ṭhānā,
ayoniso cāparihānī;
Khayo nirodho nibbedho,
ekadhammo udāyināti.

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Udāyı̄ celebrates his progress on the path, gaining faith as a householder, going forth, and realizing the Dhamma. Now he develops the awakening factors for the end of suffering.
